STUDENTS:
When we talk about developments since the Charter, it is clear that internationalization has become a major part of our curriculum.
Moreover, the “Passion & Service project in the hospitality industry-2” aims at a biger impact: promoting the motivation to learn and the passion for your future profession!!! This also increases the ambition and the performance enormously!
How do we do this? 
- International (EU) long traineeships from the first year (most of them are 16 or 17 years) they involve a major development both in personal and in their vocational learning process. "You know what you learn: because you immediately fit everything you learn in practice from theory".
- A 3 years program ( with a 5 to 6 months internships each year) in small groups and with a 'personal coach', also  during the internship.
- Internships at a high level (learning in the place and at the level where their capacities lie). This formula is unique in the Netherlands!
- The use of E-learning plays an important role in making the theory more attractive and immediately applicable.
- A better preparation for language and culture with the aim of cultivating interest and appreciation for the culture and customs of the host country. This helps them to adapt themselves during their stay. Both during the training and during the internship students are made aware of different cultures, also in the context of social inclusion (through master classes of intercultural sensitivity and interaction with other cultures).
Furthermore, the optional subject International  part I and part II components are also offered during their EU internship as an exam (see also the attached example).
- Greater opportunities for a job immediately after the study (they obtained real experience as a professional worker). Better understanding and cooperation between education and the labor market with the aim of achieving a more optimal connection.
This makes vocational training much more attractive, the opportunities on the labor market much greater and especially the sustainable employability in the labor market, the personal qualities better developed, the languages more important.
We continue to work on better and sustainable cooperation, especially with (new) foreign partners. We are working on looking for new partners who are open to this formula!
We have a large number of partners with whom we work together. Depending on the level and qualities of each student, we look for the most suitable country and type of apprenticeship for each student. As a result, the number of partner countries is sometimes larger than the number of participants we send per year.
With this project we want to make the participants aware of the personal responsibility and the positive contribution that they can make in this current society.
We are convinced that citizenship competences are of great importance in vocational education. Every student is not only a "catering student" but a "catering student full-fledged citizen in the current and future society".
In order to achieve the desired objectives, the duration of the mobility is adapted to the personal possibilities and to the study-level. The conscious choice of the partner countries will certainly make a positive contribution to the quality of the project.
The content of the project is intented for in principle for 10 students who will do a 5 to 6 months internship in the context of Horeca- Hospitality and Patisserie. The participants will follow a large part of their training path in a European receiving partner country. They gain their practical experience according to the specific competences in accredited training companies and they also do exam / validation (one example attached).
 
STAFF:
Professionalization of 4 participants (practice trainers, teachers, administrators, volunteers, etc.) so that they can develop both professionally and personally and thus bring added value to the educational institution and to the students.
We are in the process of inviting companies from the EU to come and give masterclass / guest lectures within the context of the branch and industry.
Participants take innovative training / courses  in apprenticeships and institutions in the EU countries both for their expertise promotion and for improving the quality content of the programs.
In collaboration with a number of hospitality companies in the EU countries, we will revise the study-curriculum in order to create more fluent transfer possibilities.
Improvement of languages by following language courses in order to create a better understanding during teaching and guiding.
With a number of partners, with or without Erasmus + projects, we continue to promote reciprocity. On the other hand, both parties, we experience reciprocity as a great enrichment!

Moreover, participants can enroll at any time during the year in any training programme at Europrof, therefore, a broad -based partner contact is of great importance.

- The content of the project is aimed basically at 14 students MBO BOL (Level 1 / m Level 4 ) at the initial vocational training in the context of Hotel and Catering , Hospitality, Pastry and Culinary arts. The intention is that participants go for an internship duration of between 7 and 15 weeks . They will gain their practical experience in accordance with the practical skills required in these accredited training companies.

Two applications which will have a big impact:

1 -The fact that Europrof gives participants the opportunity to do an international internship , during their first year of study  , in a   "real-life " situation, ensures  the development of their enthusiasm and interest and passion for their future work and employment ( if at 16 or 17 years of age they have this opportunity and experience, one can surmise the tremendous help and encouragement it will mean for them!!)  Our experience is that their passion and enthusiasm increases as if they were already 19 and 20 years of age.!!!.... The future will change for them . Their ambition will grow and their performance will be enhanced. 

2 - The fact that we give the students immediately  in first year, the opportunity to follow internships in 4 star* and 5 star * companies. We teach them right from the start to set the bar very high and then ... naturally passion and motivation will grow rapidly! The nice thing is that if they are looking for their  internship of the 2nd year, they are not satisfied with “lower” places .... This is the beginning of a passionate future! they learn from the beginning  at the highest level ! This improves entry and employability in the labour market .

Internationalization applied in this way you can presume it represents a real modernization of VET ! !

Improving language skills also plays an important role (e.g. English, Spanish and German ). It creates interest and appreciation for the culture and customs of the host country. This helps them to adapt during their stay.

STAFF :

A total of 6 participants (practical trainers , teachers , etc. ) .

a) internships  in approved / accredited training companies in the EU countries .

b) in collaboration with a number of Hotel and Catering Companies in the EU countries designing and developing educational modules that will be given in the new Europrof Qualification programme .

=============

With this “2 in 1”- project implementation , we are confident that we will achieve our five broad objectives , namely :

- Achieving modernization of vocational education by  internationalization

- Accelerating the development of personal, general, and branch-specific competencies

- Improving the quality of learning and teaching

- Improving employment and sustainable employability

- Increasing the value and attractiveness of vocational education through closer cooperation with  the industry

Together with a number of partners, with Erasmus + projects, we are trying to promote reciprocity.  Mutual reciprocity  we experience as a great enrichment.

Cooperating countries in the proj: AT, BE, ES , NL , IT , UK , CH and SE

Acciones de movilidad para el desarrollo de habilidades y la promoción de la competitividad y la creatividad de la industria Hostelera y el turismo
Rocco Forte & Family (The Lowry Hotel) Limited

One of the central ideas underlying European Lifelong Learning policies is that international mobility should become a natural part of education and training schemes. This helps learners to achieve higher qualification levels which are crucial for a successful first step into the labour market or for career improvements. The EU Member States are fully committed to helping young people take advantage of the opportunities open to them in terms of learning mobility. Young people participating in VET schemes are a particular focus of this commitment, and the Member States recently set a target of enabling 6% of all learners in initial VET to have completed a period of VET study abroad by 2020. In line with these objectives and European policies, through this project, the VET school(Escuela Profesional de Hosteleria de Jerez) aim to improve the quality of education and vocational training, giving a European dimension to the learning paths and thus providing the young participants the opportunity to test and improve their skills: professionalism in the specific areas of vocational education (hospitality, tourism promotion and management), cultural knowledge and linguistic preparation. This general objective, in line with the ET2020 strategy is pursued through a mobility experience that consists of a learning mobility internship abroad of 4 weeks for Level 1 students/ and a 3-month internship for 60 recent graduates from the Level 2 and 3 . The training programme includes an internship in selected companies in the sector of Hospitality industries and tourism, to acquire knowledge and skills within the sectors and compare the various professional techniques, and activities aimed at the inclusion and integration in the context and for the improvement of language skills and to better know the culture of the hosting country. The main expected results from the project include: the rise of the personal and professional skills of the students, and the promotion of key competencies related to the real exercise of active citizenship; increasing the employment potential of the participants, the introduction of innovative training methods as a complement to existing practices and pathways and the improvement of the educational level of technical and vocational schools, the development of relations between the transnational partners and the promotion of processes of cooperation and exchange of good practices between the partners involved, with a significant impact in improving the educational and vocational guidance.

The construction of a permanent network of transnational public-institutional organisations and not only, therefore, is one of the main objectives of the project and allows the exchange of experiences and best practices at various levels (technical excellence, best practices in educational policies and governance of the system). The Consortium, with this proposal, therefore, aims to give momentum to the internationalization of institutional relations and cooperation at European level. The opportunities for economic and social growth cannot be separated from the desire to create strong interdependence and synergy between educational and training institutions and strong partnerships with local and foreign business realities.

The project is, besides, implemented in an European context considering the European priority and thematic approached such as "ECVET for transparency and recognition of learning outcomes and qualifications". The development of ECVET began in 2002 after the Copenhagen Process emphasizing the need for a credit transfer system for VET. CrossCompetence is a project based on the concrete responses to the questions of developing ECVET in the European member States and corresponding to the 2009 EU Recommendations on the establishment of the European Credit system for VET. The project works in particular to realise an European area for Lifelong Learning in the field of cultural industries and the promotion and management of tourism.

The whole activities are implemented by regarding a strong European perspective which are reflected in all project activities and results. The project aims to increase the knowledge of ECVET and its technical specifications and ensuring that the added value of ECVET is understood and perceived all over Europe.
